metadata.description: Comprehensive test data for Tier System implementation
metadata.notes: This file demonstrates all tier system features including import, filtering, and bulk assignment

prompts.subject: Mathematics
prompts.question: What is the sum of angles in a triangle?
prompts.explanation: The sum of angles in any triangle is always 180°

prompts.subject: Mathematics
prompts.question: In a triangle, two angles are 45° and 65°. Find the third angle.

prompts.subject: Mathematics
prompts.question: In a right triangle with angle 30°, if the opposite side is 5cm, find the hypotenuse.

prompts.subject: English Literature
prompts.question: Who wrote 'The Tyger'?
prompts.explanation: 'The Tyger' is a famous poem by William Blake from 1794

prompts.subject: English Literature
prompts.question: Analyze the use of repetition in Blake's 'The Tyger'. What effect does it create?
prompts.explanation: The repetition of 'Tyger Tyger' creates emphasis and a hypnotic rhythm that reinforces the poem's themes

prompts.subject: English Literature
prompts.question: What is the main theme of 'To Kill a Mockingbird'?
prompts.hint: Consider the trial and its outcome
prompts.explanation: The novel explores themes of racial injustice and prejudice in the American South

prompts.subject: English Literature
prompts.question: How does Harper Lee use the character of Scout to develop the novel's themes?
prompts.explanation: Scout's first-person narrative allows readers to experience her moral growth and understanding of injustice

prompts.subject: Biology
prompts.question: What is the function of mitochondria?
prompts.explanation: Mitochondria are the powerhouse of the cell, producing ATP through aerobic respiration

prompts.subject: Biology
prompts.question: Explain why cells with high metabolic rates have more mitochondria.
prompts.explanation: Cells with high metabolic rates require more ATP, so they have more mitochondria to meet this energy demand

prompts.subject: Biology
prompts.question: What does DNA stand for?
prompts.explanation: DNA stands for deoxyribonucleic acid, the molecule that carries genetic information

prompts.subject: Biology
prompts.question: Describe the process of DNA replication and explain why semi-conservative replication is important.
prompts.explanation: Semi-conservative replication ensures each new DNA molecule contains one original strand and one new strand, maintaining genetic accuracy across generations

scenario1.name: Import with explicit tier values
scenario1.description: Test importing prompts with tier field explicitly set
scenario1.expectedResult: All prompts should have correct tier assignments (higher/foundation)

scenario2.name: Import with default tier
scenario2.description: Test importing prompts without tier field, using default tier
scenario2.expectedResult: All prompts should have default tier applied

scenario3.name: Filter by tier in admin
scenario3.description: Test filtering prompts by tier in PromptsPage
scenario3.expectedResult: Only prompts matching selected tier should be displayed

scenario4.name: Bulk assign tier to topic
scenario4.description: Test bulk assigning tier to all prompts in a topic
scenario4.expectedResult: All prompts in topic should have new tier

scenario5.name: Combined paper + tier filtering
scenario5.description: Test filtering by both paper and tier
scenario5.expectedResult: Only prompts matching both filters should be returned

scenario6.name: Tier-aware quiz running
scenario6.description: Test running a quiz with tier filter applied
scenario6.expectedResult: Quiz should only include prompts matching tier filter

scenario7.name: Tier distribution display
scenario7.description: Test displaying tier distribution in topics/units
scenario7.expectedResult: Should show counts of higher/foundation/unassigned prompts

scenario8.name: Backwards compatibility
scenario8.description: Test that prompts without tier (NULL) work correctly
scenario8.expectedResult: Unassigned prompts should appear in 'All tiers' filter
